contentrichtext.text: [[File:Nicole_Lyn_2013-07-04_11-54.jpg|thumbnail|Nicole Lyn]] {{BLP sources|date=May 2009}} {{Infobox person | image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people. Non-free and "fair use" images will be deleted - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | name = Nicole Lyn | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|02|24}} | birth_place = [[Brampton, Ontario]], [[Canada]] | spouse = [[Dulé Hill]] <small>(2004–2012)</small> | occupation = [[Actress]] | yearsactive = 1987-present }} '''Nicole Lyn''' (born '''Nicole Stephanie Danielle Lyn'''; February 24, 1978) is a [[television]] [[actress]]. She is known for her role in [[Student Bodies (TV series)|''Student Bodies'']], a Canadian teen comedy series. ==Personal life== Lyn was born in [[Brampton, Ontario]], to Cherl Gabay, a [[Jamaican]] woman of [[African]] descent, and Peter Lyn, a [[Jamaican]] man of [[Chinese people|Chinese]] and [[European people|European]] descent.{{fact|date=November 2012}} She grew up in the [[Toronto]] ([[Canada]]) area. As a child, Nicole danced in the [[National Ballet School]]'s Junior Dance division, and was also a member of the [[Canadian Children's Opera Chorus]]. Nicole entered show business when she was offered a spot on a [[Jordache]] billboard after accompanying her aunt, a model, to her audition. On July 10, 2004, Lyn married [[Dulé Hill]], an actor on ''[[The West Wing]]'' and ''[[Psych]]''. On November 28, 2012, Dulé filed for legal separation from Nicole citing irreconcilable differences.<ref name="People">{{cite news |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20651623,00.html |work=People |title=Dulé Hill and Nicole Lyn Separate' |first=Stephen M. |last=Silverman |accessdate=2012-11-28}}</ref> ==Career== She auditioned for and was admitted to [[Claude Watson School for the Arts]] at age 10. She worked filming commercials, guest starring roles, and had co-starring role on the Canadian kid-com ''[[Eric's World]]'' (1991). She later auditioned for and attended [[Cardinal Carter Academy for the Arts]] in Toronto from grade 7 - 9, where she was a dance major. She later moved to [[Jamaica]] (where her father resides) in [[10th grade]] and attended Belair High School in [[Mandeville, Jamaica|Mandeville]]. One of her first auditions upon returning to [[Canada]] was for a YTV Teen Comedy titled ''[[Student Bodies (TV series)|Student Bodies]]'' (1997), on which she landed a lead role alongside [[Jamie Elman]], Katie Emme McIninch, [[Ross Hull]], [[Jennifer Finnigan]], and [[Mark Taylor (actor)|Mark Taylor]]. Lyn made her acting debut in the television series ''[[Ramona (Canadian TV series)|Ramona]]''. She has made television guest appearances in ''[[The Kids in the Hall]]'', ''[[Are You Afraid of the Dark? (television)|Are You Afraid of the Dark?]]'', ''[[Relic Hunter]]'', ''[[Andy Richter Controls the Universe]]'', ''[[My Secret Identity]]'', ''[[The West Wing (television)|The West Wing]]'', ''[[Half & Half]]'', and ''[[Psych]]''. She was a series regular in the Canadian television shows ''[[Eric's World]]'' and ''Student Bodies''. Lyn has appeared in television films such as ''[[On Thin Ice: The Tai Babilonia Story]]'', ''[[Dying To Dance]]'', the [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] miniseries ''[[Anne Rice's The Feast Of All Saints]]'', and she appeared in the feature film ''[[Deliver Us From Eva]]''. Nicole Lyn Hill also DJs under the music name Ms. Nix. As "Ms. Nix", she serves as announcer on MTV2's ''[[Hip Hop Squares]]''. ==External links== * {{IMDB name|0528194}} ==References== <references/> <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> {{Persondata |NAME = Lyn, Nicole Stephanie Danielle |ALTERNATIVE NAMES = |SHORT DESCRIPTION = [[actress]] |DATE OF BIRTH = February 24, 1978 |PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Brampton, Ontario|Brampton]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]] |DATE OF DEATH = |PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lyn, Nicole}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Actresses from Ontario]] [[Category:Black Canadian actresses]] [[Category:Canadian television actresses]] [[Category:Canadian people of Chinese descent]] [[Category:Canadian people of Jamaican descent]] [[Category:People from Brampton]] {{canada-tv-bio-stub}}
